metadata.Title: CVE-2023-22458 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description: Redis is an in-memory database that persists on disk. Authenticated userscan issue a `HRANDFIELD` or `ZRANDMEMBER` command with specially craftedarguments to trigger a denial-of-service by crashing Redis with anassertion failure. This problem affects Redis versions 6.2 or newer up tobut not including 6.2.9 as well as versions 7.0 up to but not including7.0.8. Users are advised to upgrade. There are no known workarounds forthis vulnerability.

criterions.comment: redis: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
